text:
South Africa‚Äôs labour market is at a critical crossroads. The country cannot grow sustainably while millions remain locked out of work, and we cannot solve unemployment without fixing the skills-to-demand gap and accelerate real pathways.

In his response to SONA 2026 questions, today President @CyrilRamaphosa reinforced the urgency of tackling unemployment and strengthening demand-led skills that match what the economy needs (including critical technical and professional skills), through coordinated action across government, business, education, and society.

At the same time, the latest labour force data released by Statistics South Africa confirms that unemployment remains among the highest in the world, with more than 31% of the labour force still unemployed ‚Äî disproportionately affecting young people and those attempting to transition from learning into work.

These trends underscore a shared national imperative that, we must move beyond dialogue to measurable action on skills, jobs and inclusive labour market participation.

Since 2025, Career Indaba¬Æ has been coordinating a structured national response to this priority. The Career Indaba¬Æ Expo & Bootcamp (15‚Äì16 May 2026) serves as South Africa‚Äôs National Employment & Skills Network, convening employers, education institutions, policymakers, organised labour, learners and job seekers within a coordinated environment focused on practical workforce progression.

Through this national gathering, we aim to strengthen school-to-work transitions, reduce labour market fragmentation and expand equitable access to sector-aligned skills pathways, employment opportunities, learnership programmes, bursary funding and structured training routes.

The time to make a shift from commitment to taking action is now. If your organisation is committed to transforming policy intent into measurable impact, this is the moment to align with the journey of building a more inclusive and economically resilient South Africa.

#SONA2026 #Employment #SkillsDevelopment #YouthEmployment #DemandLedSkills #CareerIndaba #SouthAfrica #StatsSA #SkillsMismatch #NationalEmploymentAndSkills #leadership #Industry #Sector #Education

#CareerPathways in the #Fintech and #Mobility sector.
Jamie Wyngaard‚Äôs career reflects a modern African innovation journey moving between entrepreneurship, design thinking, fintech, and infrastructure-building, while keeping people at the centre of every solution.

As Co-Founder and CXO of Loop, his work sits at the intersection of mobility and money, building cashless payment systems and inclusive mobility infrastructure designed for real-world African conditions, not ideal ones.

This feature explores what it means to build technology for emerging markets where innovation is not defined by novelty, but by access, dignity, and practical problem-solving at scale.

Featured in Career Indaba¬Æ Magazine‚Äôs inaugural edition.

#CareerPathways in the #Technology and #DigitalSystems sector.
Osvaldo Museta‚Äôs career has not followed a straight line. It has moved through detours, reinventions, and deliberate pivots from a Zimbabwean childhood shaped by constraint and longing, to global digital consulting and automation systems work.

Now an Automation Systems Specialist at Titan Network, his journey reflects the modern labour market: self-directed learning, cross-border collaboration, remote work, and the ability to translate diverse skills into systems thinking.

This feature explores imposter syndrome, burnout, unemployment, and professional reinvention, and what it means to move from searching for belonging to building impact across industries.

Featured in Career Indaba¬Æ Magazine‚Äôs inaugural edition.

#CareerPathways in the #Engineering and #Manufacturing sector.
From the rural paths of iMpendle to leading engineering strategy at JA Engineering Works (Pty) Ltd, Mthobisi Zuma has built a career defined by endurance, discipline, and the ability to deliver results under pressure.

Raised by his grandmother after losing both parents at a young age, his story reflects how careers are shaped not only by education and opportunity, but by resilience, leadership judgement, and the environments professionals must navigate to progress.

Today, as Head of Engineering, his journey offers insight into leadership across difference, workforce mobility, and what it means to remain grounded while rising through highly technical and performance-driven industries.

Featured in Career Indaba¬Æ Magazine‚Äôs inaugural edition.

#CareerPathways in the #Financial #Services, Actuarial Science & Retirement Systems sector. In a financial system under pressure, true leadership is measured not only by technical precision, but by the lives it safeguards. #Meeta Gosai‚Äôs career as an actuary at Momentum Corporate is shaped by discipline, faith, and an unwavering commitment to people.

Over years of deliberate growth, she has helped design retirement solutions that prioritise clarity, trust, and dignity while leading teams with humanity in one of South Africa‚Äôs most complex financial arenas. This is a career story about responsibility, long-term thinking, and leadership with heart.

Her journey reflects what it means to lead with conviction in a numbers-driven industry, guiding families into homeownership, mentoring others, and proving that purpose and professionalism can coexist without compromise.

#InsuranceSector South Africa‚Äôs insurance sector is entering a defining era shaped by digital transformation, AI-driven decision-making, climate risk, regulatory complexity, and shifting consumer expectations. In this environment, leadership is no longer about technical competence alone. It is about judgement, systems thinking, governance, and the ability to lead institutions through uncertainty.

This feature explores how @inseta - Insurance Sector Education and Training Authority, under the leadership of CEO Ms Gugu Mkhize, is strengthening the sector‚Äôs leadership pipeline through strategic partnerships with @HenleyBusinessSchool - Africa, @GIBS Business School (GordonInstitute of Business Science), and the Graduate School of Business - University of Cape Town. It is a timely example of how skills development, executive education, and institutional collaboration are becoming strategic levers for long-term sector sustainability

Discover how sector-led skills investment is strengthening insurance leadership pipelines. Click here https://t.co/Y6vQ7p6Cbs

#CareerPathways in #HumanCapital and #Transport sector.  #Mmabatho #Tlale (LLM)‚Äôs career reflects a modern African leadership journey, one where ambition is matched with humility, and systems are shaped with humanity at their core. 

From a Sepulana-rooted upbringing in Bushbuckridge to the executive corridors of @ZedaLimitedZA, her career path demonstrates how law, human capital, and lived experience can converge to widen opportunity and restore dignity in the workplace.

As Chief Human Capital Officer, Mmabatho has progressed from operational roles into strategic leadership, building cultures that align performance with purpose. Along the way, she has balanced executive responsibility, advanced legal studies culminating in an LLM in 2025, and motherhood without compromise. 

Her leadership has delivered tangible outcomes, including Top Employer Certification on the first attempt, award-winning wellness and engagement initiatives, and recognition as a leading voice in human capital strategy. At its core, her career is about people ‚Äî how they are seen, developed, and trusted to thrive.

In this inaugural edition of Career Indaba¬Æ Magazine feature, Mmabatho reflects on resilience, intentional growth, and why Africa‚Äôs future of work must be both globally competitive and deeply humane.

#CareerPathways in #Finance, Capital & Enterprise Development. @CleolaKunene stands at the forefront of Africa‚Äôs small business economy, not as an observer, but as a system builder. 

As Head of Small and Medium Enterprises at the Johannesburg Stock Exchange @JSE_Group, her work has reshaped how capital, policy, and opportunity intersect for entrepreneurs across the continent. From pioneering SME-focused market solutions within one of Africa‚Äôs most critical financial institutions, to contributing to global policy discourse through the G20, Cleola‚Äôs leadership reflects a rare combination of technical depth, strategic foresight, and unwavering commitment to economic dignity.

In this deeply personal career reflection, Cleola traces the landscapes, lessons, and clarity that have shaped her career journey ‚Äî from navigating complex financial systems to advocating for inclusive enterprise growth. She reveals why championing Small and Medium Enterprises is not simply her profession, but a lifelong purpose rooted in enabling access, credibility, and sustainable opportunity.

This inaugural edition of Career Indaba¬Æ Magazine timeless career legacies feature offers insight into leadership at the intersection of finance and development and highlights the critical role SMEs play in shaping Africa‚Äôs economic resilience and future of work.

#CareerPathways in #Education sector driven by entrepreneurship, purpose, and youth development. The late @IsaacMongali was building for Africa‚Äôs future while many were still debating it. As the founder of #CareerKit, his work was anchored in an urgent conviction that Africa‚Äôs talent must be seen, supported, and given #pathways to thrive.

This feature honours Isaac not as a career journey unfinished, but as a vision already in motion. Isaac‚Äôs leadership was defined by faith, precision, and an unwavering commitment to young people navigating education, work, and possibility in complex systems. In this rare and poignant instance, the career archive fulfils its purpose of preserving what mattered when time intervene. 

Isaac‚Äôs positive impact lives on through the organisation he built, the team he entrusted, and the thousands of young people whose futures he helped illuminate.

This inaugural edition of Career Indaba¬Æ Magazine timeless career legacies, this feature reflects on a career legacy that will live on ‚Äî reminding us that meaningful careers are measured not only by longevity, but by purpose, reach, and the lives shaped along the way.

Sector-aligned #CareerPathways in the #Food #Services #Industry. The @KFCSA‚Äôs #Streetwise #Academy is an initiative that is demonstrating how employer-led skills development can translate entry-level work into nationally recognised qualifications, leadership pathways, and long-term employability. 

The academy is a compelling example of how accredited workplace learning can address skills gaps, support youth progression, and strengthen workforce readiness within the quick service restaurant sector.

Featuring KFC Africa‚Äôs Streetwise Academy for its role in investing in people through accredited learning, and practical leadership development that converges to expand access to meaningful career pathways.

The Academy reflects how well-structured, accredited learning can unlock opportunity and build leadership capacity within the workforce.

#CareerPathways perspective in the #Education and #Training sector. In conversations about unemployment, skills shortages, and workforce readiness, qualifications are often referenced, yet behind every credible career pathway sits a system that determines whether learning is recognised, trusted, and transferable.

The South African Qualifications Authority @SAQALive is the custodian of the National Qualifications Framework, and how its work underpins skills recognition, employability, and mobility across South Africa‚Äôs labour market.

Established in 1995, @SAQALive continues to play a central role in aligning education, skills development, and the world of work at a time when clarity and trust in qualifications matter more than ever. 

South African Qualifications Authority (SAQA)‚Äôs mandate is to ensure that skills are recognised, qualifications are trusted, and career pathways remain accessible within South Africa‚Äôs labour market.

#CareerIndabaMagazine #CareersIntelligence #SkillsDevelopment #LabourMarket #PublicSector

#CareerPathways in the Media & ICT industry. Keneilwe Ntaolang‚Äôs journey from Ga-Rankuwa to becoming an award-winning Performance Marketing Manager at MTN is a testament to resilience and determination.

Raised by strong women who taught her the value of hard work and community, Keneilwe‚Äôs career is marked by courage and reinvention. She believes in leading with heart, creating opportunities for others, and transforming teams through empathy and integrity.

Her story is not just about personal success; it‚Äôs about lifting others along the way. Discover how Keneilwe‚Äôs legacy is shaping the future of leadership and inspiring the next generation to achieve the impossible.

This feature forms part of Career Indaba¬Æ Magazine‚Äôs growing digital career archive, capturing career intelligence across sectors for those navigating leadership, responsibility, and professional legacy. Watch the summary

#CareerPathways in #Engineering & #Manufacturing sector. Pinkie Portia Ngongoshe‚Äôs career journey reflects how technical careers are built through discipline, resilience, and the courage to step into spaces where representation has historically been limited.

From Kwaggafontein in Mpumalanga to her role as a Fitter at JA Engineering Works (Pty) Ltd, her path illustrates how engineering careers are often forged through perseverance rather than privilege. Entering a male-dominated industry, Pinkie‚Äôs journey is not defined by defiance alone, but by sustained belief in her capability, commitment to learning, and respect for craft.

Through apprenticeship, technical training, and practical experience, she has built credibility in an environment where trust is earned through precision, safety, and consistency. Her career offers perspective on artisanal and technical pathways within engineering ‚Äî where leadership is expressed through competence, teamwork, and accountability on the job.

Pinkie Portia Ngongoshe‚Äôs story forms part of Career Indaba¬Æ Magazine‚Äôs inaugural edition, contributing to a growing digital career archive that recognises careers built from the ground up, and the role of #women in shaping the future of technical industries.
